result.execSummary:
The defendant Teresa Anguiano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fin.Trans.Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a)1a.
  • Fin.Trans.Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a)1a.
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain GED or HSED.  While obtaining diploma, defendant may work part time.  Once diploma is achieved, defendant mus obtain and maintain full-time employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  Defendant is not to have any narcotic drugs of any kind, even with a prescription.  Defendant is to sign medical release to allow agent access to medical and prescription records.  Agent is to approve all prescriptions.

For the first six months of probation, defendant must attend 5 self-help meetings per week if not employed, and 3 per week if employed, and provide signed proof of attendance.Take all medications as prescribed.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including psychological evaluation. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Defendant Teresa Anguiano in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Noah Michael Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.  Plea to Cts 3,4,5 in CF case  DRI ct. 1 and 2 and the charges in the CM file.  probation recommended  GPQPA filed.

Defendant pleas GUILTY and is found GUILTY by the court

Judge conducts plea colloquey

State recommends probation with some jail time.  No restitution is requested.  1 day CFTS.  

6 months jail I&S each count 18 months concurrent probation ordered
Conditions:
must complete hs diploma or GED - can work part time while obtaining GED or diploma
must obtain ft employment after diploma is achieved
take medications as prescribed by a doctor- no addictive medications should be prescribed or taken.  Release to be signed for the agent  
Attend for first 6 months 5 self help meetings a week if not employed or 3 if employed.  
obtain signature everytime you go to a meeting and turn them into your agent to verify.
AODA assessment and treatment if agent deemed appropriate.  Any other psychological assessments as deemed appropriate by the agent.
cc and cost of supervision.  DNA surcharge.
Defendant may petition the court for expungment if she successfully completes probation.
1 day CFTS.
